intro: Matelea tenuis, commonly known as the slender matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or scrubland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
